description: The platform API empowers developers to automate, extend and combine Heroku with other services.
title: Heroku Platform API

_88slug.description: A slug is a snapshot of your application code that is ready to run on the platform.

$eref.description: identification of the code with your version control system (eg: SHA of the git HEAD)
hash mapping process type names to their respective command

links.title: Create

_88process_types.description: hash mapping process type names to their respective command

_88url.description: URL to interact with the slug blob

$eref.description: identification of the code with your version control system (eg: SHA of the git HEAD)

___blob.description: pointer to the url where clients can fetch or store the actual release binary

endpoint for redirection after authorization with OAuth client

_88formation.description: The formation of processes that should be maintained for an app. Update the formation to scale processes or change dyno sizes. Available process type names and commands are defined by the `process_types` attribute for the [slug](#slug) currently released on an app.

___updates.description: Array with formation updates. Each element must have "process", the id or name of the process type to be updated, and can optionally update its "quantity" or "size".

$eref.description: Properties to update a process type

_88formation.title: Heroku Platform API - Formation

_88id.description: unique identifier of this process type

_88log-drain.description: [Log drains](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/logging#syslog-drains) provide a way to forward your Heroku logs to an external syslog server for long-term archiving. This external service must be configured to receive syslog packets from Heroku, whereupon its URL can be added to an app using this API. Some addons will add a log drain when they are provisioned to an app. These drains can only be removed by removing the add-on.

$eref.description: url associated with the log drain

links.description: Delete an existing log drain. Log drains added by add-ons can only be removed by removing the add-on.
links.title: Delete

_88log-drain.title: Heroku Platform API - Log Drain

$eref.description: unique identifier of this log drain
url associated with the log drain

_88url.description: url associated with the log drain

_88id.description: unique identifier of this log drain

$eref.description: url associated with the log drain
token associated with the log drain
unique identifier of this log drain

_88ssl-endpoint.description: [SSL Endpoint](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/ssl-endpoint) is a public address serving custom SSL cert for HTTPS traffic to a Heroku app. Note that an app must have the `ssl:endpoint` addon installed before it can provision an SSL Endpoint using these APIs.

$eref.description: contents of the private key (eg .key file)
raw contents of the public certificate chain (eg: .crt or .pem file)
contents of the private key (eg .key file)
raw contents of the public certificate chain (eg: .crt or .pem file)
indicates that a rollback should be performed

_88id.description: unique identifier of this SSL endpoint

_88rollback.description: indicates that a rollback should be performed

$eref.description: [Log drains](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/logging#syslog-drains) provide a way to forward your Heroku logs to an external syslog server for long-term archiving. This external service must be configured to receive syslog packets from Heroku, whereupon its URL can be added to an app using this API. Some addons will add a log drain when they are provisioned to an app. These drains can only be removed by removing the add-on.

links.description: Delete an existing log drain. Log drains added by add-ons can only be removed by removing the add-on.
links.title: Delete

$eref.title: Heroku Platform API - Log Drain

_88token.description: token associated with the log drain

_88url.description: url associated with the log drain

_88id.description: unique identifier of this log drain
